A basic resource found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You have no idea what monster bit this is. Can be used as a bone, organ or hide!

Card Text.

If the Gorm is defeated when this card is in play, the settlement gains +2 Gorm resources during the Aftermath.

is a White Lion hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Failure.
Full move monster forward in a straight line. Cancel all hits now out of range. Any survivors passed over suffer Grab.

Grab: Place target knocked down in front of the monster. Target suffers 1 damage per monster level.

Critical Wound.
(Cancel on this card.)

You strike the White Lion's stout heart. Gain 1 random White Lion resource. Roll 1d10. If the result is 10, the White Lion dies instantly.

is a White Lion hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.

Critical Wound.
(Cancel on this card.)

You bruise the White Lion's femur, crippling its graceful movement.

The White Lion gains -1 movement token. Gain 1 random White Lion resource.

You may consume this. If you do, your lips turn gray, your hair whitens and you become infertile. Gain +1 courage, +1 understanding and suffer the destroyed genitals severe waist injury.

Nightmare Blood: Whenever you gain a bleeding token, add to all hit locations.

Card Text.
Consume: Archive this to roll 1d10. On a 1-3, you become ill from the fetid mass. Gain the Anemic impairment. On a 9+, it goes down with relative ease. Gain the Hemostasis ability.

A basic resource found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Remains of an extinguished lantern.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The survivors come across the shattered ruins of a small settlement. Ashen corpses dot the ruins, disintegrating at the slightest touch. An extinguished lantern oven stands intact at the center of the settlement.

The event revealer rolls 1d10 and adds their understanding. If the result is 5+, gain the Lantern Oven innovation. If the settlement already has this innovation, the event revealer harvests a broken lantern basic resource from the remains.

If the settlement has Song of the Brave, the group may nominate a brave survivor to investigate the ruins of the settlement's lantern hoard. They gain +1 courage and roll 1d10.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Roll 1d10 to scavenge. If carrying a Scavenger Kit, add +1 to the result.

Setup.
Set up adjacent to the monster. (Unless otherwise stated in the showdown setup instructions.)

is a strange resource card found in the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
Consume: Gain +2 survival. There is something in its belly! Gain 1 random vermin and consume it immediately. Archive this card.

This is a Dragon King Monster Resource found in the Dragon King Expansion.

Card Text.
A dense bundle of bloody tubes.

This is a Lion God Strange Resource found in the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.

During the settlement phase, you may archive this to Death Reading.

Card Text.
These nails are never clipped. Instead, they are folded and hammered hundreds of times into an impossibly fine edge.

is a strange resource card found in the Manhunter Expansion.

Card Text.
You may consume and archive this to remove all bleeding tokens and any severe injury of your choice.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
Each survivor rolls 1d10. The lowest-scoring survivor (or survivors, in case of ties) becomes the straggler. If any survivor (or survivors) has the Anxiety disorder, they are the straggler. Do not roll.

The straggler is lost in a moment of profound self doubt. They slip, not having the will to catch themselves, and tumble off a steep hill of stone faces. They land awkwardly with a crunch, suffering the broken leg severe injury. Sobbing to themselves, they come to grips with just how terrible their life is and gain +1 understanding.

If the straggler has the Binge Eating disorder, they wipe away their tears and reach out to a nearby critter, instinctually cramming it into their mouth for comfort. Draw 1 random vermin resource and consume it.

is a Strange Resource found within the Slenderman Expansion.

Card Text.
This strange crystal refracts light, concentrating it within a natural, sword-shaped chamber.

Cultivated Crypt is a Dragon King hunt event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You uncover a crypt littered with the preserved corpses of dragons. You may Defile the Crypt and draw up to 3 random Dragon King resources. Otherwise, gain +1 understanding and roll a random hunt event.

Defile the Crypt.
If you draw 1+ resource, the Dragon King begins the showdown with the Overheat mood in play.

If you draw 2+ resources, the Dragon King also begins the showdown with a +1 damage token.

If you draw 3+ resources, the Dragon King also begins the showdown with a +1 speed token.

Roll a random hunt event if you do not Defile the Crypt

is a White Lion Monster Resource found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
When you gain this, a random survivor gains +1 insanity.

Holding this fills you with sadness.

is a Sunstalker Monster Resource found in the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
Extremely reflective and colorful.

is a Vermin Resource found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Consume: Archive this and roll 1d10.

' is a strange resource found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. It has the King crest, and is therefore only used in campaigns with the King quarry monster.

Card text.
A heavy hunk of metal etched with a shifting sequence of foreign characters.

An innovation card found within the Slenderman Expansion.

Card Text.
Departing survivors gain +2 insanity.

 Light-Forging

 Spend 2x resources and 2x Dark Water to
increase the level of Dark Water
Research by 1, to a maximum of 3.
(Update your settlement record sheet).

Rules Explanation.
The Dark Water research innovations included in the Slenderman expansion has 3 levels: 1-3. These levels are recorded on the Settlement Record Sheet. When a settlement first gains the innovation, its level is always 1.

The levels of Dark Water Research increase through endeavoring at the innovation. Settlements with higher levels of Dark Water Research have more options within the Light-Forging Slenderman Story Event. Increasing the levels of Dark Water Research does not count as gaining a new innovation.

is a Screaming Antelope hunt event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
The survivors are struck by the scent of rotting meat wafting from a hulking corpse ahead.

The event revealer may lead the survivors to investigate. If they do, gain 1 random vermin resource, 2 random Screaming Antelope resources and roll 1d10. On a result of 7+, the survivors are startled by the arrival of the antelope's killer, a White Lion.

End the hunt now. Start a showdown with a White Lion 1 level higher than the quarry or the highest level available, using its setup rules. Add a Dead Monster terrain card to the showdown.

If they don't investigate: roll a random hunt event.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
If Dead Monster is drawn during the Showdown Setup, survivors may start the showdown anywhere on the showdown board. Survivors may go first. 
Scavenge. Roll 1d10.

Setup.
Set up adjacent to the monster.

is a Phoenix hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
+2 toughness to wound this location.

Critical Wound.
The terrific attack slams into the Phoenix's massive frame. It hesitates, shocked that a puny human could harm it.

Gain 1 random Phoenix resource. The Phoenix staggers. Cancel any until the end of the attack.

is a Phoenix hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

You strike the monster's thick neck.
Critical Wound.
Your blow damages the cervical vertebra, crippling the Phoenix's defenses.

Gain 1 random Phoenix resource. The Phoenix gains -1 toughness token.

Card Text.

is a story event in the Gorm Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
Approaching their quarry, the survivors are overcome by a sickening miasma.

When the survivors arrive at the showdown, each survivor Approaches the Cave. During the aftermath, all victorious survivors make a Blind Exit.

Approach the Cave.
each survivor rolls 1d10.

The Gorm's den can be tracked by smell from a great distance. Your eyes water and your stomach twists in knots as you approach.

|-
|4 - 7||The entrance to the Gorm's den swims with putrid vapor. As the survivors consult amongst themselves in hushed, rasping tones, you decide to combat the miasma with a little ingenuity, putting your waist armor on your head. Add your current waist armor points to your head armor points and reduce your waist armor points to 0. Gain +2 insanity and +2 survival.
|-
|8 - 10||Tears streaming and lungs burning, you stumble into the den. Roll 1d10.

|}

Blind Exit.
each victorious survivor rolls 1d10.

Sickened and exhausted, the survivors attempt to investigate the hazy Gorm den.

Ways to Trigger.

A Flower Knight Hit Location.

Wound.
The Flower Knight's eyes beam strangely.
Attacker gains +1 courage and is knocked down unless they spend 1 survival.

Critical Wound.
The sight of the elaborate armor in ruins is gratifying.
If the Flower Knight is inside the Fairy Ring, it gains -1 toughness tokens and attacker gains +1 luck token and 1 random Flower resource.

A Flower Knight Hit Location.

Wound.
The Flower Knight's eyes beam strangely.
Attacker gains +1 courage and is knocked down unless they spend 1 survival.

Critical Wound.
The delicate iridescent fabric is destroyed.
Attacker gains +1 luck token and 1 random Flower resource.

A Flower Knight Hit Location.

Reflex.
The Flower Knight slowly cranes its neck towards the attacker.
If the attacker has any stinky gear in their gear grid, they gain the priority target token.

Critical Wound.
The Flower Knight's helmet is damaged.
If the monster is inside the Fairy Ring, it gains -1 accuracy token and attacker gains +1 luck token and 1 random Flower resource.

is a Dung Beetle Knight hit location card found in the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion.
Card Text.
 The monster crushes a keystone. Move the ball 1d10 spaces towards the monster. Cancel the reaction on this hit location.

Reflex.
If the attacker is within 3 spaces of the monster, they are grabbed and smashed into the ball. Place the attacker in the nearest unoccupied space adjacent to the Resin Dung Ball. They collide with it and suffer 5 damage to hit locations.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 random Dung Beetle Knight resource.

The is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book. Following immediately after the , it consists of a showdown against a White Lion with a specially-constructed AI Deck and then a Settlement Phase that uses First Day instead of a random Settlement Event. It is meant to teach the core rules of the game through gameplay and prepare players to begin a campaign.

A terrain card found within the Flower Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
Pick a flower. Archive this terrain tile and roll 1d10. Add +1 to your roll if you have a Sickle in your gear grid.

Setup.
Set up within 2 spaces of a board edge. (Unless otherwise stated in the showdown setup instructions.)

is a strange resource card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Archive this to fully heal 1 hit location, including injury levels and armor points.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
A carpet of skittering bugs points the survivors to a freshly killed monster. The scavenging insects try to defend their dinner, but the survivors fight them to claim the prize. 

Each survivor rolls 2d10 and adds their Hunt XP. The highest-scoring survivor (roll off in case of ties) slays the most vermin and wins the putrid prize for themselves. They gain 1 random basic resource and 1 random vermin resource.

Fresh Kill is a beta strange resource card found in the Summer Aya White Box/Limited Release.

Card Text.
 Consume: Archive this and set your survival equal to half your survival limit, rounded up.

is a Screaming Antelope hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You strike the magnificent, bushy tail.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 Screaming Antelope resource.

The Screaming Antelope is off balance. The monster gains -1 accuracy token.

is a Screaming Antelope hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
If you hit with a club or shield, you clobber the monster and gain +2 luck when attempting to wound this location!

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 Screaming Antelope resource.

There is a chance that this blow snaps the Screaming Antelope's neck, killing it.
Roll another 1d10. On a result of 10, the Screaming Antelope dies instantly.

' is a strange resource found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. It has the Scout crest, and is therefore only used in campaigns with Scouts.

Card text.
Consume: Archive this to gain the Spectral Stomach ability.

Spectral Stomach: When you consume and archive something, roll 1d10. On a 8+, it comes out the other end intact! Do not archive it.

is a Screaming Antelope hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.

(Super-Dense: If the attacker hits this location with a frail weapon, it is damaged. Archive the weapon at the end of this attack.)

is a Screaming Antelope hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
-2 toughness to wound this location.

Wound.
Blood and spittle erupt from the Screaming Antelope's wounded under-maw. If the wound roll result is even, suffer 1 brain damage. If the wound roll result is odd, gain 1 insanity.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 Screaming Antelope resource.

is a vermin resource found in the Pinup Easter Twilight Knight white box expansion.

Card Text.
When you gain this, unless you consume it immediately, it latches on and removes all head armor points. If this is in the settlement storage when survivors depart, add another to storage and suffer -1 population.

Consume: Archive this and roll 1d10.

is a Phoenix hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Turn to face the attacker.

Wound.
Perform displacement.

Displacement: Place the Phoenix anywhere along the board edge furthest from the attacker. If the attacker has any age tokens, they may attempt to follow the Phoenix. Roll 1d10. If the result is equal to or less than their Hunt XP, place them in a free space adjacent to the Phoenix after it is placed. Otherwise, cancel all hits now out of range.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 random Phoenix resource.

is a Phoenix hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Reflex.
The monster's glare pierces the survivor's puny mind, causing explosions of pain.

Turn to face the attacker and roll 1d10. If the result is higher than the attacker's Hunt XP, they suffer 1 brain damage for each age token they have.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 random Phoenix resource.

You smash apart the monster's foot. In triumph, you may spend 1 survival to howl and encourage all knocked down survivors.

is a Screaming Antelope hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game. 

1.5 Card Text.
Failure.
If the attacker is adjacent to the monster, their weapon is stuck. Tugging frantically, it comes loose, but you stumble and suffer knockback 5.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 Screaming Antelope resource.

 Persistent Injury - Crushed Crown
Blood pours from the ruined crown. Affects some AI cards.

1.6 Card Text.
Failure.
If the attacker is adjacent to the monster, their weapon is stuck. Tugging frantically, it comes loose, but you stumble and suffer knockback 5.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 Screaming Antelope Resource.

 Persistent Injury - Ruined Horns
Blood pours from the ruined crown. Affects some AI cards.

Note.
Crushed Crown Persistent Injury in the 1.5 version of the card refers to Gore's Ruined Horns Persistent Injury. The Crushed Crown Persistent Injury is not associated with any AI cards and Ruined Horns doesn't appear on any HL cards. This issue was fixed with the release of the Legendary Card Pack and the game's update to version 1.6.

See Also.
Gore

A Legendary Monster found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Lore.
They say that at the summit of the tallest tree, there is a 
glimmer of golden light. Those who have stared into it for too 
long are marked by their white hair, and claim to know how 
they will die.

Stat Breakdown.

Victory.
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon proficiency (if eligible)
Level 3 Phoenix Rewards.
6x Basic Resources
9x Phoenix Monster Resources
1x Phoenix Crest
1x Black Lichen
Nominate the survivor that dealt the killing 
blow. At that moment, time splits and you experience a 
thousand lifetimes and a thousand deaths simultaneously. Your 
veins feel as if they will burn themselves free from your skin, 
and you cling desperately to a single heart beat, as you find 
yourself within the cyclone of existence that howls without end. 
The experience ends as abruptly as it started. All of what 
happened or what will happen is gone. forgotten, and you find 
yourself on your knees vomiting a thick creamy foam. The 
nominated survivor gains +1,000 insanity and the King of a Thousand Battles secret fighting art.

Defeat.
Use Phoenix defeat.
You may not Run Away from this encounter.

Ways to Trigger.

The Gormchymist is a settlement location found in the Gorm Expansion. It is unlocked the first time survivors defeat a Gorm.

Location Text.
Transmute: Spend 2 organs and roll 1d10. Add 1d10 for each Gormchymy innovation in your settlement. Add the roll results and gain the corresponding gear or resources.

Archive 1 Gormchymist potion to reroll 1 dice result.

Special Innovate.
Gain the next Gormchymy innovation.

1x Gorm Brain

is a Legendary Monster found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Lore.
They say that some thunderstorms on the horizon are actually the Great Golden Cat playing with a meal before devouring it.

Stat Breakdown.

Victory.
Use Level 3 White Lion Victory
+1 White Lion resource of your choice
Nominate the survivor that dealt the killing blow. That survivor gains a +2 permanent strength and the Timeless Eye and Combo Master fighting arts.

Defeat.
Use White Lion defeat.

Ways to Trigger.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
A massive Gregalope stands astride the horizon, its ancient body bloated with tumors and scar tissue. Its milky eyes catch sight of the survivors and it bounds away. Driven by sudden desire, the survivors give chase. The event revealer rolls 1d10 and adds their movement to their roll.

If any survivor has the Strategist fighting art, they may corner the Gregalope at a giant stone face instead of giving chase. If they do, end the hunt immediately. Start a showdown with a level 2 Screaming Antelope, using its setup rules. In addition, place a Giant Stone Face adjacent to the monster and give the monster the Butcher's Berserker trait card. If the survivors prevail, gain the normal showdown rewards and 3 additional Screaming Antelope resources.

 Before attempting to wound, perform Ground Pound. Cancel the reaction on this hit location.

Card Text.
If the settlement has a Barber Surgeon, you may undergo a procedure there! Archive this and roll 1d10. Add +4 to your roll if there is a Silk Surgeon. On a 6+, the surgeon swaps your optic nerve. Cure the blind severe head injury. Otherwise, suffer it from a terrible accident.

is a Lonely Tree Strange Resource found in the Lonely Tree Expansion.

is a story event in the Manhunter Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
The Manhunter is pleased with how easy it is to cull your settlement. It returns to claim a survivor for an unknown purpose.

The settlement gathers to Draw Lots.

Draw Lots and then choose to Rebel or Obey. Roll 1d10.

If you rolled a 3 or a 4 and if the settlement has the Collective Toil Society Principle, use the Give me a slave! result instead.
If you rolled a 5 or a 6 and if the settlement has the Accept Darkness Society Principle, use the Give me your smartest! result instead.

Rebel.
Stop the Settlement Phase for a Special Showdown with the Manhunter.

Obey.
The nominated survivor is taken away. Remove them from the settlement. Do not gain the benefits of the Cannibalize Death Principle. Add Lottery to the timeline two lantern years from now. The Manhunter provides the settlement with Payment. Roll 1d10.

is a basic resource found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
During the settlement phase, you may
archive this to . Nominated
survivors must be able to consume.

' is a strange resource found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. It has the Dream Keeper crest, and is therefore only used in People of the Dream Keeper campaigns.

Pressurized ammonia.

' is a strange resource found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. It has the Crimson Crocodile crest, and is therefore only used in campaigns with Crimson Crocodile.

Card text.
Eons of tongue polishing have made the perfect tooth!

is a Legendary Monster found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Lore.
They say that The Hand once trained a great, horned beast to be ridden by him along. As the beast carried The Hand from one terrible task to the next, its appetite grew, and its horns took on twisted shapes.

Stat Breakdown.

Victory.
Use Level 3 Screaming Antelope Victory
+1 Screaming Antelope resource of your choice.
Nominate the survivor that dealt the killing blow. As your weapon strikes down the steed, it emits a gurgling roar from its under-maw, and bursts into an explosion of flames. Inside the inferno's swirling vortex, you feel only calm. A hooded figure stands before you, and points at your arm. With a blinding flash and a spray of molten flesh, it explodes, causing you to scream and black out. When you wake, you peel the remaining charred flesh off of what used to be your arm, revealing a beautiful sword underneath. The nominated survivor suffers the dismembered arm severe injury, and gains the Red Fist secret fighting art, +9 courage, and the Adventure Sword rare gear.

Defeat.
The Mad Steed rampages through the settlement, leaving immeasurable destruction in its wake. -3 population.

Ways to Trigger.

is a Gorm hit location card found in the Gorm Expansion.

You strike at the Gorm's swinging jowls.

Critical Wound.
Gain 1 random Gorm resource.

Flank: A space adjacent to the monster that is
not in the monster's facing or blind spot.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
Exhausted, the survivors rest. During their fitful sleep, a small insect approaches undetected. Choose 1 random male survivor and roll on the table. If there are no male survivors, nothing happens.

If the chosen survivor has the Unconscious Fighter fighting art, they crush the bug while still snoring; do not roll on the table. They awake, confused, with a random vermin resource in their hands.

The Master Key can open anything! Archive this to ignore any locked requirement. Departing survivors can take this with them.

Mating Fields is a Gorm hunt event card found in the Gorm Expansion.

Card Text.
Ahead, the ground is covered in mounds of foul-smelling corrosive vomit. Any of the survivors may choose to investigate. Each that does gains +1 courage and rolls on the table.

1d10 - Each survivor, one at a time

Roll a random hunt event if no survivors investigate.

Climbing the giant nightmare tree, the scout discovers a nest. Instead of eggs, they find a mass of hoary whiskers. A brood of shriveled ancient phoenixes sits with their long beards tangled together. They look at the scout helplessly. Roll 1d10.

is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
There was once a mad woman who spent her days talking into the darkness. One day, it spoke back. 

The group must choose one.

Collective Toil.
Tainted by darkness, a survivor nearly brought ruin to the settlement. On the day of her exile, the people decided that all must spend equal time hunting and working to avoid future disasters. -1 population. Add " Bone Witch" to the timeline 3 years from now.

The settlement gains the Society Principle: Collective Toil. Find and place the card on the settlement board and note it on the settlement record sheet.

After adding the card to the settlement roll 1d10.

Accept Darkness.
The darkness spoke startling truths. It told the people they were monsters just like the ones they hunted. The people accepted their monstrosity and their place stalking in the darkness.

The settlement gains the Society Principle: Accept Darkness. Find and place the card on the settlement board and note it on the settlement record sheet. 

After adding the card to the settlement roll 1d10.

is a showdown story event in the Dragon King Expansion.

Lore.
There was a monster that was alone in the world. Abandoned in its grief, the monster crawled deep inside its aching heart until it broke nad was set aflame. Now, the power of its grief and fury pours like invisible poison from the weeping face it hides inside its hulking body.

Aftermath.
Victory.
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency Level (if eligible)
+Rewards

Rewards.
The first time the Dragon King is defeated, add the Dragon Armory to the settlement locations.

The group gains the following rewards:

Level 1
4 basic resources 
4 Dragon King resources
Level 2
4 basic resources
6 Dragon King resources
1 Pituitary Gland strange resource
Level 3
4 basic resources
8 Dragon King resources
1 Shining Liver strange resource

If the settlement has innovated Sculpture when you defeat a Level 2 Dragon King, gain a Radiant Core strange resource.

Defeat.
You may choose to leave or recover the remains. If you leave, do not gain the benefits of the settlement's Death Principle. If you recover the remains, gain the benefits of your Death Principle but a survivor becomes sick in the process. Suffer -1 population.

is a story event in the Flower Knight Expansion.

Lore.
In the heart of the forest dwells a delicate gardener who appreciates solitude over all things. Sadly, the dangerous flora and fauna it cultivates are desired by many. To preserve the hidden world it has created for itself, it trades its tools for a deadly blade without hesitation.

Hunt Setup.
Select an encounter level and set up the hunt board. When survivors land on the Overwhelming Darkness space, they instead resolve The Forest Wants What It Wants.

Aftermath.
Victory.
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency (if eligible)
+Rewards

Rewards.
When the survivors defeat the Flower Knight, they gain the Flower Knight Badge rare gear. Add the Petal Spiral innovation to the settlement's innovation deck.

If any survivors have the Fencing secret fighting art and the Ghostly Beauty disorder, they gain the Narcissistic disorder and +1 permanent evasion.

Next settlement phase, Sense Memory

The group gains the following rewards:

Level 1
4 basic resources 
4 Flower resources
Level 2
4 basic resources 
6 Flower resources
Level 3
4 basic resources 
8 Flower resources
1 Sleeping Virus Flower rare gear

If the settlement innovated Petal Spiral when you defeat a Level 3 Flower Knight, all survivors with the Fencing secret fighting art and the Ghostly Beauty and Narcissistic disorders gain the True Blade secret fighting art.

Defeat.
The Flower Knight makes rich fertilizer of the survivors' corpses. Gain no benefits from your Death Principle from losing these survivors.
relatedTerms: The Forest Wants What It Wants

terms.definition:
is a story event in the Sunstalker Expansion.

Lore.
There is a great castle in the sky shaped like a sword. At the top stands the Storm. Tired of its ineffective challengers, the Storm sought to give them an advantage. The Storm dragged the oldest Sun into the sky and chained it to the top of its castle to give its challengers light. Now, when a challenger is defeated and rain strikes the stone-faced floor, the Sun cries out for help, igniting the sky with desperate flashes of light.

Aftermath.
Victory.
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency Level (if eligible)
+Rewards

Rewards.
The first time the Sunstalker is defeated, gain the Sky Reef Sanctuary settlement location.

Each survivor who has defeated 1 or more Shades gains +1 courage.

Level 1
4 basic resources 
4 Sunstalker resources
1 Sunstones strange resource
Level 2
4 basic resources 
6 Sunstalker resources
1 1,000 Year Sunspot strange resource
Level 3
7 basic resources 
8 Sunstalker resources
1 3,000 Year Sunspot strange resource

If the settlement has innovated Storytelling when you defeat a Level 3 Sunstalker for the first time, add Edged Tonometry to the next year on the timeline.

Defeat.
The tormented shadows of the defeated survivors rush back to the settlement, fading to nothing as they embrace their terrified loved ones. If the settlement has the Graves Death Principle, the settlement gains the Shadow Dance innovation.

The Spidicules' eyes rattle in its head, and it babbles like crazy!
